snippet.title: NSW counter-terrorism police charge two men over alleged plot
snippet.content: New South Wales counter-terrorism police have charged two men arrested in raids last weekend in Sydney. A 49-year-old man from Lakemba and a 32-year-old Punchbowl man have each been charged with two counts of preparing for, or planning, a terrorist attack. Both men are due to face court in Parramatta tomorrow morning. Another man - arrested at Surry Hills - remains in police custody. More to come.
